sections.heading: Vegetable Coloring Tips
sections.text: A. Layering Colors: For something like a red pepper, start with an orange base. Layer reds on top, going darker towards the top. Add yellow highlights. B. Textured Effects: Use the side of a pencil or crayon edge to create a bumpy, ridged texture on corn kernels or peas in the pod.

tips.colors: Use greens for leafy veggies like lettuce and spinach. Reds, oranges and yellows work for tomatoes, carrots and corn. Purples are great for eggplants and beets.
tips.challenge: Use a colorful array of natural hues found at your local farmers market – vibrant reds, oranges, greens, purples. This challenge helps practice illustrating a variety of organic shapes, colors and textures. It encourages thoughtful color combinations reminiscent of fresh produce.

crafts.title: 5 DIY Veggie Crafts
crafts.text: Get ready to veg out with these delightfully healthy and creative veggie projects! Supplies Needed: Instructions: What You’ll Need: Here’s How: Gather These: Steps: You’ll Need: Instructions: Supplies: Let’s Make It! These tasty vegetables are adding some serious flavor to your coloring pages. But they’re feeling a little lonely, so let’s invite their sweet fruit friends over to play! Carrot and Corn are already jumping with excitement at the thought of a delicious coloring adventure together!
